edit.title: Editing {{name}}
edit.popover_content:
The Custom Commands list is saved in Localstorage.
That means you can come back here whenever you want and they will be here.

This Command is not in that list now.

import.title: Import Radiopanel.txt
import.copy: Place imported customs into the Custom List
import.required: You need to input the file!
import.parse_error: Something went wrong with parsing. Are you sure this is a valid VDF File?

success.title: Output
success.desc: If you know where your game is installed, replace the contents of csgo/resource/ui/Radiopanel.txt.

form.label: Name
form.label_hint: Name appears on the Radio menu
form.tooltip: If you don't want a color anymore, set it to black.

chelp.title: Custom Commands Help
chelp.p1: Radio messages are console commands. Which means, by editing the UI file (radiopanel.txt) you can replace the radio messages with any console command.
chelp.p2: I have noticed not a lot of people know about this, and as it can be a boring process don't even bother trying.
chelp.p3: You go mad with the possibilities, buying presets (I recommend memorizing the buying numbers), changing your crosshair using 2 buttons, disabling voice.

prompt.title: Confirmation Required
prompt.body: Are you sure you want to
prompt.creset: reload the custom list from the server (Will delete current)

help.title: Help
help.p1: The radiopanel.txt lies at the csgo/resource/ui directory. There are two ways of accesing it.
help.m1_2: Right click Counter Strike: Global Offensive>Properties>Local Files (tab)>Browse Local Files.
help.bkp: Please, make a backup of any files you're going to modify.
help.m2_42: and replace the contents with the result.
help.lib: If you haven't changed the library, the default is the Steam installation folder, which again, if is default should be in
help.m2o_5: (I hope it's the same path/name) and replace the contents with the result.
help.c_4: if the OS X Methods are wrong.

messages.takingfire: Sob fogo inimigo, preciso de ajuda
